Your precious joke has been added…
You have no internet. That is sad. We can\'t add your sweet little joke.

The joke list just got emptier, thanks to you.\n>:(
The jokes will stick with you until you get some good tasting internet.
We love your jokes so much we don\'t know why we can\'t part with them! Maybe try again.
You need internet to restore the database?! This app sucks.
The problem seems to be… up there. Let me try to ask… \n\nHey, you up there! What\'s the hold up?? Oh, not sure, huh.
id: %1$s
I don\'t even know myself… Maybe there are no jokes on the cloud.

Database reset
Are you REALLY sure you want to reset the database to its original state? Note this can\'t be undone. Like, really. All your own original jokes will be lost forever! Choose wisely…
Yes, I\'m sure! I hate these jokes!
Never mind! I really love my jokes!
How did I even get here…

Pay to play

This feature is only in the paid version. So if you don\'t like your jokes, buy the paid version so we can sweetly remove any sour ones you don\'t like anymore. \n\nIf not, then stay sour! We don\'t like you anyway! :)
OK, Take me to the store!
Fine, Never mind…
OK, I suck

Yeah, you do. Suck it up.
I hate you too

I tried to get a joke from my cloud, but then I realized I had no internet. Since when did we get so dependent on the internet?? \n\n#FirstWorldProblems

I just added a cool joke to my jokes cloud database! Here it is.

I tried to remove some jokes from my jokes cloud database… but then I remembered I need internet to access the cloud. Such a silly thing. \n\n#CloudProblems
I tried to do something that requires internet connection. Like what is internet? \n\n#IAmADumbFool
I thought my jokes cloud database was full of dumb jokes, so I decided to start over from scratch to create even a better database!! \n\n#OnceAFoolNeverAgainTheySay

About
Dismiss
Jokes \nCreated by Teddy Rodriguez

Jokes was created by Teddy Rodriguez as part of a Gradle project provided by the Udacity Android Nanodegree Program. It takes advantage of Gradle's capabilities in integrating Java and Android libraries to build a single, cohesive application. It also utilizes Google's Cloud Platform, on which a backend is created that stores jokes pulled from a Java library, and allows for their retrieval and modification. 

All original database jokes were gathered from Comedy Central's online jokes database, and their intellectual rights are held by their respective writers. 


App last updated Sunday, April 17, 2016.
Libraries used
